task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and target zone, approach and align the circular TCP, set yaw, then push the block straight toward the target before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block on a planar workspace until it reaches a marked target zone. The behavior prioritizes visual confirmation of both the block and goal, a short vertical clearance approach, fine in-plane alignment, yaw setting, and a single straight push. The control/observation cadence is modest (10 Hz), so actions use conservative timeouts and a simple, robust sequence. After the push, the robot retreats and pauses to avoid disturbing the final placement.
preconditions: T-shaped block present within camera view
Target zone visible on the table
stepwise_plan: Ensure the block and target are visible; scan if not.
Move above the block with small vertical offset.
Approach and align laterally with tight tolerance.
Set and verify yaw for a straight push.
Execute a straight push toward the target.
Retreat and briefly wait for settling.
success_criteria: Block’s centroid overlaps the target zone outline
No collision with table fixtures or robot self-collision
Final pose remains stable after retreat
failure_and_recovery: If object is not visible, perform scanning again.
If alignment fails, re-run ApproachAndAlign and yaw verification.
If push stalls or slips, re-approach and reattempt with the same path.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreat and short wait once the push action is completed.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear side contact with alignment cue before push; tool oriented and close to the T-block.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation is expected immediately afterward, confirming goal direction.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T-block is visible.
Scan workspace to locate the T-block if not immediately visible.
Checks if the goal zone is visible.
Scan to localize the target zone.
Position TCP above the block with small clearance.
In-plane approach and precise lateral alignment.
Orients the TCP for straight-line pushing.
Verifies the current yaw is as commanded.
Pushes the block toward the target along 0° direction.
Backs off to avoid disturbing the final pose.

failure_modes: Block or target not detected due to occlusion
recovery_strategy: Shorter second push if overshoot occurs
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and dark tool; instruction colors (gray/green/blue) differ—treated as semantic labels.
Push direction interpreted as approximately toward the right (0°) based on frame progression.
Target is the drawn outline on the workspace; no 3D constraints beyond planar contact.

expected_success_criteria: T-block overlaps target outline after push
No additional motion after retreat and wait
